newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian government to draw up Internet plan.
newsitem.headline: Indian government to draw up Internet plan.

text.p: Two Indian government departments will jointly present an expansion plan to strengthen the Internet information superhighway in the country, a statement issued by the Communications Ministry said on Monday.

"The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) and the Department of Electronics (DoE) would jointly draw up a national expansion plan for Internet to be presented at a subsequent meeting of the full Telecom Commission, it was decided," the statement issued after a meeting of the commission said.

The state-controlled Videsh Sanchar Nigam Ltd (VSNL) currently has a monopoly on Internet services. The government has promised to lay down a policy to allow Internet service providers, but the policy has not yet been announced.
